snippet: A Spanish court convicted 53 people in the country’s biggest-ever corruption trial, which centered on real estate fraud and bribery in a resort town.
abstract: Spanish court convicts 53 people in country’s biggest-ever corruption trial, which lasted two years and centered on widespread real estate fraud and bribery in the southern resort town of Marbella; mastermind Juan Antonio Roca receives 11 year sentence and is fined $326 million.
lead_paragraph: A Spanish court convicted 53 people in the country’s biggest-ever corruption trial, which centered on real estate fraud and bribery in a resort town.

headline.main: Spain: Court Convicts 53 People in Corruption Trial
headline.print_headline: Spain: Court Convicts 53 People in Corruption Trial
